value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">find at the centre of the labyrinth of words, a man</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">sitting alone in his college room, thinking – about</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Now the reader is <del>aware of</del> completely in being</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">He can read in many different moods. He can</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">satisfy the desire for information, he can</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">draw in from the printed page knowledge of times past:</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[illeg.] anecdotes; reflections; he can see England</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">at the moment: he can <del>forge</del> circle forwards &</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">backwards; he can draw in what feeds</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>reflections; or</del> he can read directly what is on the page;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">or drawing aside can read what is not <del>said</del> there.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The <del>reader then</del> A <del>sense of sense of</del> <del>a sen</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Time seems endless. There is a <add>[lifeblood?]</add> continually in the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">book that the play has not. It gives a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">different pace to the mind. <del>It loosens it</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>from the present moment.</del> We are in a </l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">world where nothing is concluded. And</l>
